com.xhive.core.interfaces
Interface XhiveSegmentIf

public interface XhiveSegmentIf

A segment is a logical storage location in an X-Hive database. Each database always has at least one segment, the default segment. The default segment can never be deleted without deleting the database. Segments can be added and deleted programmatically using the X-Hive API.

More information about files and segments can be found in the manual in the chapter Internal structure of X-Hive/DB.

(c) X-Hive Corporation B.V. (www.x-hive.com)

Since:
X-Hive 3.0
See Also:
for more information on segments and files.

Method Detail

getId

java.lang.String getId()
Get the id of the segment.

Returns:
the id of the segment.
Since:
X-Hive/DB 5.0

addFile

XhiveFileIf addFile(java.lang.String path,
                    long maxSize)

Add a file to this segment.

The name of the new file will be automatically generated according to the following scheme: [databasename]-[segmentname]-[fileno].XhiveDatabase.DB

Parameters:
path - The path to location where the new file should be created in. If null then the path is the same as that of the bootstrap file.
maxSize - The maximum size (in bytes) that the file is allowed to grow to. A value of 0 means the size is unlimited.
Returns:
the newly created file.
Since:
X-Hive/DB 5.0

getFiles

java.util.Iterator<? extends XhiveFileIf> getFiles()
Get an iterator for iterating over all the files in this segment. The iterator returns XhiveFileIf objects.

Returns:
an iterator for iterating over all the files in this segment.
Since:
X-Hive/DB 3.0

getFreeSpace

long getFreeSpace()
Find the amount of free space in the segment. This is the space that is part of the files of the segment, but does not currently contain database objects. This method only counts free pages. Free space in partly filled pages that have been allocated to documents, indexes, etc. is not counted.

Returns:
The number of bytes in free pages of the segment.
Since:
X-Hive/DB 5.0

delete

void delete()
Delete this segment. This segment can only be deleted if it is empty (contains no data) and if it is not the default segment.

Throws:
XhiveException.INVALID_USE - If this segment is the default segment
XhiveException.SEGMENT_NOT_EMPTY - If this segment contains files that are not empty
Since:
X-Hive/DB 3.0

isTemporary

boolean isTemporary()
Find out if this segment is for temporary data.

Returns:
Whether this is a temporary data segment.
